book.title: The Anti-Social Family
book.author: Michele Barrett and Mary McIntosh
book.description: Sensitive but uncompromising socialist-feminist critique of the nuclear family
book.review: “An extremely brave, and with the benefit of hindsight, what must appear to be a very daring critique of the family."

book.title: Fortunes of Feminism
book.author: Nancy Fraser
book.description: Charts the history of women's liberation and calls for a revitalized feminism.
book.review: “Nancy Fraser is among the very few thinkers in the tradition of critical theory who are capable of redeeming its legacy in the twenty-first century.”

book.title: The Erotic Margin
book.author: Irvin C. Schick
book.description: Reviewing the large, disparate, and often contradictory western discourse on gender and sexuality of the Other
book.review: “Schick explores the netherworld of ethnopornographic sources, then returns to high ground with a theory of alterist discourse that opens new horizons for eveyone interested in representations of the Other. I know of no other work that theorizes the exoticization and eroticization of the Other with such rigor or such far-reaching implications.”
